extendedIngredients.name: corn
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup finely cracked dried whole corn

extendedIngredients.name: nuts
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup seeds (sunflower,milet,sesame,amaranth,even seeds from sweet & hot peppers) or cracked nuts
extendedIngredients.originalName: seeds (sunflower,milet,sesame,amaranth,even seeds from sweet & hot peppers) or cracked nuts

extendedIngredients.name: yellow cornmeal
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups yellow cornmeal , more if to sticky
extendedIngredients.originalName: yellow cornmeal , more if to sticky

title: A Homemade Bird Treat For Your Feather Friends
summary: A Homemade Bird Treat For Your Feather Friends requires approximately 10 minutes from start to finish. For $3.44 per serving, this recipe covers 65% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 3615 calories, 85g of protein, and 225g of fat. This recipe serves 1. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of cracked nuts, cornmeal, flour, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. It is a good option if you're following a vegan diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 94%. This score is spectacular. Try Treat Your Family and Friends to this Super Moist Zucchini Bread, Homemade Bird Dog Pizza, and Homemade Bird Dog Pizza for similar recipes.
instructions: In a food processor blend first 5 ingredients till all combined.If needed add more cornmeal to make it workable.Place it in a plastic bag and refrigerate till ready to use.I like to put a string on pine cones then smear the mixture on it roll into seeds and hang for those that want it.Or mix it (Seeds And mixture) all together and place into a suet cage or in an onion bag to be hung in a tree.Just keep on making for the birds because they depend on it once you start.

steps.step: In a food processor blend first 5 ingredients till all combined.If needed add more cornmeal to make it workable.

Place it in a plastic bag and refrigerate till ready to use.I like to put a string on pine cones then smear the mixture on it roll into seeds and hang for those that want it.Or mix it (Seeds And mixture) all together and place into a suet cage or in an onion bag to be hung in a tree.Just keep on making for the birds because they depend on it once you start.
